result.execSummary:
The defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (>$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

Seek and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms

Undergo a mental health evaluation.
Urine screens.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
May not vote until her civil rights have been restored.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample if one was not previously ordered and on file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant 's Bail Forfeiture HEARING Notice returned undeliverable.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeds.  In Court is Surety, Julie Hoaglan.  Statements made by both parties.  Court ordered $100.00 bail to be returned, $200.00 remains forfeited.
Cash bail is reinstated in order to schedule case for Bail Forfeiture Hearing 03-03-15

Surety, Julie H., contacted this office requesting a bail forfeiture hearing.  She never received prior notice because she had moved. She has filed a change of address with this office and CCAP has been updated.  BF Hearing Notice has been sent and Surety contacted by phone, by this office, this date, informing her of the 03-06-15 Court date.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON *03-06-2015at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Letter from surety regarding posted bail.
No reply from surety or defendant.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($300.00) ad
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7/25/14. Bench Warrant received.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in custody.  Tyron St Junior via telephone for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Defendant had court in Waukesha County this morning and was taken into custody.  Case remains calendared in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.   Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan not in court.  Denis Stingl appeared on behalf of Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Discharge Summary, filed.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested one last adjournment.  Court granted same, as State had no objection.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation report from JusticePoint, received and filed. lms
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn

Defense counsel requested a plea date; to be determined if defendant is eligible for drug treatment court.  Court granted defense request and ordered all conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Jay R Pucek appeared on behalf of Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Violation Report or missed office contact and new arrest, received and filed
Defendant is in custody on her new arrest.  Court to address the violation at the next court date in Branch 20 on 4-29-2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Tyrone St. Junior for Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/31/14.
